defaultValue: Changing these settings can impact the stability of your game. Only the default configuration is tested to work.
Some settings will not apply unless you start a new game. Restarting your game client after changing settings is advised, some settings will not apply otherwise.

fieldDescription: This enables a mode in which your colonies will start bleeding money the more you make. It means getting a colony above 200k income is an incredible feat, but getting it to 50-100k is just like vanilla. Calculated along f(x)=x^(-0.6)
Income up until this number is not penalized by corruption (if enabled)
Commerce balance changes. Read up on why this was needed here: bit.ly/commerce_balance. Can be disabled during an ongoing campaign to revert to vanilla behaviour (might need to re-dock).
The row amount in most of the ship picker dialogues in the mod.

Toggles Pets, the pet cryochamber dropping in campaign, abandoned pet stations spawning and the industry being available. To completely remove pet food from your game, go to Industrial.Evolution\data\campaign\commodities.csv and delete the line for pet food. This requires a new save file and will cause a crash unless pets are disabled from the start.
Enables salvage events as well as derelict infrastructure and industries
Amount of Coronal Taps * number = amount of automated shipyards. Default taps is 2, so default shipyards is 3 (2 * 1.5). Rounds up.
Amount of crucibles in the sector. Static number. Defaults to 1.
Master chance for a special event to be applied to an entity that does not have one. Note that the chance is actually lower as every entity has a defined chance to resolve to nothing.
Enables the custom station types like orbital labs and arsenal stations
Amount of additional stations with custom types spawned on top of existing ones (0.2 = 20%% additional)

defaultValue: All loot added by this mod is on top of the normal loot you would have gotten. At no point does Industrial Evolution edit, dilute, change or in any other way influence vanilla drop behaviour.

fieldDescription: Makes starship components drop from combat - Relic components will still drop even if you disable this.

fieldName: [Commodities] Relic Component Hard Battle FP Advantage
fieldDescription: How much more FP an enemy fleet has to have for it to drop relic components on defeat
How much of said fleet you have to destroy for it to drop relic components
General on-off toggle.
Chance for a meteor shower to spawn. One month has 10 ticks, 2 percent per tick = 18 %% chance per month = 92 %% per year. Increasing this by 0.1 raises monthly odds by about 30 %%, so use caution.
Minimum intensity per swarm instance.
Maximum intensity per swarm instance. Increasing this past 4 can cause lag.
Base width of a swarm.
Additional width added per 1.0 intensity.
Upper cap for meteor count density scaling. Increasing this can cause lag.
Maximum multiplier applied to runtime from intensity and conditions. Increasing this can cause lag.
Baseline duration of a meteor shower in seconds. Too long = too many meteors on screen = lag.
Cooldown in days for the same location after a swarm spawns. 31 days x 6.
Global cooldown in days after any swarm spawns.
Positional grid clamp for spawn calculations. Provided as setting if you somehow use a mod that has larger than usual star systems.
Maximum allowed spawn distance from the system primary in game units.
Minimum allowed spawn distance from the system primary in game units.
Upper angle bound for spawn cone relative to reference axis in degrees.
Lower angle bound for spawn cone relative to reference axis in degrees.

defaultValue: Tip: You can disable minefields temporarily with an interdiction pulse.

fieldDescription: Needs a new game!
Every ship in the fleet is added up and adds to the chance of getting hit by a mine
Every ship in the fleet is added up and adds to the chance of getting hit by a mine
Every ship in the fleet is added up and adds to the chance of getting hit by a mine
Every ship in the fleet is added up and adds to the chance of getting hit by a mine
The minimum fleet size needed before mines can explode in your face when going slow
Civ ships count half ect for above
Only works on new game. Disabling this means you have weak bones.
How likely a system is to have an artillery station. Reduce this number to make them rarer. 1 = between 5-10%% of all systems will have one.

fieldName: [Artillery] Stars per station in a constellation
fieldDescription: Specifies how many artillery stations can spawn per X stars in a constellation. Default = One station per 3 stars. The lower the number the more clustered the stations are. Setting this too high will result in no stations spawning.

Time in days for watchtowers to reset to the faction controlling the artillery. This is needed to avoid "dead" artilleries after being highjacked by a pirate station and subsequently having their watchtowers taken by an invasion.
Delay between shots - if the artillery has two valid targets, it'll take that long to fire at both of them
Cooldown on single target - it shoots at you, then waits this long, then shoots again
Multiplies cooldown for NPC fleets because they get demolished otherwise
=6 map cells
Base fleet size that spawns to defend artillery stations. Has to be 1 at minimum or it crashes.
If you increase this you should also increase the fuzz mult
By how much the shots miss their target, higher = mor
Must be divisible by 2
Maximum area the missiles cover - also depends on fuzz
How accurately the missiles anticipate your location; less than 1 makes 'em kinda useless

defaultValue: To completely remove consumable items, go to Industrial.Evolution\data\campaign\procgen\drop_groups.csv and set the relevant group weights to 0. Deleting them will cause a crash.
All loot added by this mod is on top of the normal loot you would have gotten. At no point does Industrial Evolution edit, dilute, change or in any other way influence vanilla drop behaviour.

fieldDescription: Toggles if consumable items show up on markets.
Toggles if consumable items can drop from fleet encounters.
Toggles if the research project at galatia is available.
Enables or disables the Variable Manufactory. Note that disabling the Variable industries will not stop VPCs from dropping - you will have to remove the entries from drop_groups.csv to achieve that.
Enables or disables the Variable Assembler
Enables or disables the Commodity Forge
Enables or disables the Military Relay
Enables or disables the Interstellar Relay
Enables or disables the Centralization Bureau
Enables or disables Salvage Yards, disable this to disable starship components. You can not have one without the other. Edit the drop groups to remove components completely.
Enables or disables the Supercomputer
Enables or disables the Embassy, also disables Ambassador management scripts.
Enables or disables the Senate
Enables or disables the Restoration Docks
Enables or disables the Academy
Enables or disables the Requisitions Centre
Enables or disables the Engineering Hub
Enables or disables the Courier Port
Enables or disables the Privateer Base
Enables or disables Specialized Refining
Enables or disables Specialized Mining
Enables or disables the Museum
Setting this to true makes planetary governments behave like vanilla pop&infra and turns them into a cosmetic choice.

Specifies how large a colony may be to in order to change the government type. Building up a stable colony and then changing is cheating and takes away from how these are supposed to work: higher rewards for higher difficulties.

Disable the auto-whitelist and return to the strict manual entry based whitelist system. This means that only ships that are listed in the reverse_engineering.csv whitelist are eligible to be researched.
Yes, this is the one you are looking for (NOTE: post version 4.0 has an auto-whitelist that is much broader and you may not need this setting anymore)

fieldName: [Engineering Hub] Auto Transfer BP to Gathering Point
fieldDescription: Remember - Courier Port Exists
Required Relic Components per FP for zero D-Mods
Base D-Mod count on ships built via the Yards
Mult for how much components contribute towards the budget - default means every component contributes 1.2x its standard cost towards the budget
Italian Sounds while person on crotch rocket delivers Paragon to hungry space captain

fieldName: [Salvage Yards] D-Mod Moving Base Cost Mult
fieldDescription: How much it costs to move a D-Mod compared to restoring it. By default, it's cheaper to move the D-mod by 0.8x the restoration cost. I think. Can't remember, might also be total cost.

fieldName: [Courier Port] Base Cost per cargo unit
fieldDescription: Transport cost per cargo space used. Some items take more space than others: a nanoforge takes 10 cargo space. Affected by distance.

fieldName: [Courier Port] Base Cost per ship unit
fieldDescription: Transport cost per ship DP. Larger ship, larger cost. Affected by distance.
The base fee of a shipment, not affected by distance.
This setting changes how impactful distance is to the cost calculation. The higher the value, the more distance will factor in.

fieldName: [Privateer Base] Raid only for Unknown BPs
fieldDescription: Allows the Privateer base to raid for blueprints you already know. Setting this to TRUE will make it only generate BPs you do not know, instead of a mix
Auto-deliver the looted items to the gathering point. Remember - courier port exists.
Derelict infra build cost and time reductions
All derelict industry output will be delivered to the gathering point instead of local storage. Remember - courier port exists.
in LY
Auto-deliver restored forge templates to the closest HullDecon  Remember - courier port exists.
Leave this one alone, you want the engineering hub

fieldName: [Hull Deconstructor] Allow Deconstructing the Nex Omega Merc
fieldDescription: Added on request :)
Auto-deliver finished forge templates to the closest HullForge  Remember - courier port exists.
Print ships off a template until it is empty - FALSE = deposit in storage after one run
Auto-deliver degraded forge templates to the closest lab - or empty ones to a Deconstructor (AI Core Effect only)  Remember - courier port exists.
Core run time in days until burn out. Tooltips will be broken if number is not a multiple of 31.
Core run time in days until burn out. Tooltips will be broken if number is not a multiple of 31.
Core run time in days until burn out. Tooltips will be broken if number is not a multiple of 31.
AI mode restoration Fees per dMod
AI mode restoration Fees per dMod
AI mode restoration Fees per dMod
AI mode restoration Fees per dMod
For officers and admins, per person, per month
Auto-deliver to production point (default - To local storage)  Remember - courier port exists.

fieldName: [World Wonders] Cloud Painter Shield Texture Removal
fieldDescription: Makes the cloud painter remove the planetary shield texture so clouds stay visible

fieldName: [World Wonders] Cloud Painter Shield Alternate Texture
fieldDescription: Replaces the planetary shield texture with a colourless alternative texture, making clouds stay visible in addition to having a perceptible shield texture. Does not apply if Shield Texture Removal is set to true!
The maximum credits a ship can earn per month while exhibited
The minimum credits a ship can earn per month while exhibited - may not be bigger than max credits
Default parade slots without modifiers
Maximum number of ships allowed to participate in a single parade.
Minimum number of ships required to initiate a parade.

fieldName: [Museum] Top Ship Pool Amount for Parade Selection
fieldDescription: Number ships considered during random parade participant selection, counting down from the highest valued one.
Immigration bonus granted while a parade fleet is active.
Stability bonus granted while a parade fleet is active.
Additional parade capacity gained when the structure is improved.
Extra parade slots provided when an Alpha Core is installed.
Amount of required income per +1 stability when a Beta Core is installed.

fieldName: [Museum] Beta Core Income per Point Immigration
fieldDescription: Amount of required income per +1 immigration when at when a Beta Core is installed.
Multiplier applied to total income when a Gamma Core is installed.
Multiplier applied to the value of unique ships.
